R10543 Sr. Front End Engineer (Open)

Job Posting Title:

Sr. Front End Engineer

Job Description:

The Front End Engineer is a seasoned software engineer who designs, develops, troubleshoots and debugs complex software applications, demonstrating for others how to resolve issues in innovative and practical ways.

The role works on problems of diverse scope where analysis of data requires evaluation of identifiable and obscure factors, applying good judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions; takes initiative in planning and prioritization of design and development activities to resolve a wide range of issues; interacts with senior internal and external personnel; and may act as a technical lead on complex projects.

As a recognized specialist in one or more fields, the role is a key contributor to complex projects, advising on design and development approach. Through leadership and expertise, the Front End Engineer acts as a role model to inspire, teach and help develop team members, moderates peer review and mentors junior staff.

Will be responsible for
  • Building simple and elegant front-end components using latest in Javascript, CSS, and HTML5
  • Working closely with the Design and Product teams to create streamlined and responsive user experiences.
  • Driving architectural and technical decisions for improving products and processes
  • Consuming API and Platform services to build dynamic user interfaces
  • Coaching and mentoring other engineers
Qualifications
  • Demonstrable expertise in building rich and elegant HTML5 web interfaces
  • Proficiency in HTML, JavaScript and CSS.
  • Deep knowledge of JavaScript. Know how to leverage prototypes and closures.
  • Experience developing applications for multiple browsers.
  • Must be eager and able to quickly absorb new technologies and become expert in them.
  • Bachelors degree in Computer Science or a related field
  • Past experience building SaaS products
  • Experience writing clean, modular code in large JavaScript codebases
  • Experience building unit tests
